--- title: "Count the number of characters (or bytes or width)" date: '2022-05-10' category: til output: html_document --- From the [documentation](https://rdrr.io/r/base/nchar.html), `nzchar()` is a fast way to find out if elements of a character vector are non-empty strings. It returns `TRUE` for non-empty strings and `FALSE` for empty strings. ::: {.panel-tabset} ### Not Empty Vector ::: {.cell} ```{.r .cell-code} # This is not empty Sys.getenv("R_LIBS_USER") ``` ::: {.cell-output .cell-output-stdout} ``` [1] "/Users/ivelasq/Library/R/x86_64/4.3/library" ``` ::: ::: ::: {.cell} ```{.r .cell-code} # This returns TRUE nzchar(Sys.getenv("R_LIBS_USER")) ``` ::: {.cell-output .cell-output-stdout} ``` [1] TRUE ``` ::: ::: ### Empty Vector ::: {.cell} ```{.r .cell-code} # This is empty Sys.getenv("test") ``` ::: {.cell-output .cell-output-stdout} ``` [1] "" ``` ::: ::: ::: {.cell} ```{.r .cell-code} # This returns FALSE nzchar(Sys.getenv("test")) ``` ::: {.cell-output .cell-output-stdout} ``` [1] FALSE ``` ::: ::: :::
